meanings.definition: A loud and confused noise, especially that of people shouting.
meanings.sent1: The clamor of the children playing outside could be heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were filled with the clamor of cars honking and people talking.
meanings.sent3: The clamor of the monkeys in the zoo made the visitors giggle.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the clamor of the busy market, she found a moment of peace.
meanings.sent5: The clamor of the thunderstorm was both frightening and exhilarating.

meanings.sent1: She would clamor for attention whenever her favorite song came on.
meanings.sent2: The fans began to clamor for their favorite team as they entered the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The children would clamor for ice cream every time the truck drove by.
meanings.sent4: The protesters continued to clamor for justice in front of the courthouse.
meanings.sent5: His voice clamored over the noise of the crowd, demanding to be heard.
